Employers are hiring back workers they recently let go at a steady clip, however many job losses are becoming permanent.</span>

<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Your thoughts, Jerome? </strong></span><span>In an </span><span><a href="https://www.npr.org/2020/09/04/909627932/feds-jerome-powell-jobless-rate-better-than-expected-recovery-to-take-a-long-tim?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">interview with NPR</a></span><span>, Fed Chair Jerome Powell called the jobs report a “good one,” but stressed that the economy will need low interest rates for a long time in order to regain full strength.</span>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MARKETS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/04/storylines-behind-recent-stumbles-nasdaq?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Reading Into the Market’s Recent Stumbles
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Stocks declining" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMzM0L3N0b2Nrc19kZWNsaW5pbmcuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Wrapped up in Thursday’s fourth-largest daily point drop in Nasdaq history, and yesterday’s grim-but-not-as-grim second act, is a series of intriguing storylines.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Green traders get battle scars</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The rash of inexperienced individual investors getting involved in risky options trading has been a consistent theme during the market’s epic rally. And vets who preached caution are finally getting their “told you so” moment. With <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-09-03/day-trader-options-frenzy-turns-ugly-in-730-billion-nasdaq-rout?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$730 billion worth of value</a> erased from the Nasdaq on Thursday, lots of poorly timed options contracts were wiped out. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Insiders have been selling</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">U.S. executives <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/78ed6f29-a8ea-4c46-aba0-556eae378b79?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sold $6.7 billion</a> worth of their own companies’ stock in August. If that sounds like a lot, it is.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Last month’s garage sale was the largest monthly tally since November 2015, while the number of execs cashing out was the highest in two years, according to the FT.  </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Selling activity like this paints a less-than-optimistic picture for the future, but who can blame insiders for “harvesting a once-in-a-millennium bonanza,” macro strategist Vincent Deluard told the FT. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">SoftBank flies too close to the Son</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Never one to miss out on massive trades with extreme risk, the Japanese tech conglomerate led by Masayoshi Son has been revealed as the “<a href="https://www.ft.com/content/75587aa6-1f1f-4e9d-b334-3ff866753fa2?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Nasdaq whale</a>” that’s been snapping up an astonishing amount of options tied to Big Tech companies. In addition to buying nearly $4 billion worth of shares in the likes of Amazon, Apple, and Netflix, SoftBank reportedly spent another $4 billion purchasing <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/softbanks-bet-on-tech-giants-fueled-powerful-market-rally-11599232205?mod=breakingnews&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">bullish call options</a> that would pay off bigtime if those stocks hit a certain level in the future. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Some investors say SoftBank's activity may have been partly responsible for the recent surge in Big Tech stocks. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Flashback: </strong></span><span>Now might be a good time to remember Son </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/04/23/masayoshi-son-invested-in-bitcoin-and-reportedly-lost-130-million.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">lost over $130 million</a></span><span> of his own money after getting into bitcoin around its peak in 2017. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Most analysts say not to read too much into the recent sell-off, given the Fed's pledge to support markets with liquidity and the ongoing economic recovery. </p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
REAL ESTATE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/04/amazon-goes-hiring-spree-bellevue-washington?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Amazon’s Hiring Team Is Going Beast Mode
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="A rendering of office Amazon office buildings in Bellevue, WA" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMzM1L2FtYXpvbl9yZW5kZXJpbmdfYmVsbGV2dWUuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Amazon</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Bezos is out here memorizing Rachmaninoff's third while the rest of us are learning “Chopsticks.” The same day stocks continued their sell-off and the jobs report showed a labor market still in tatters...Amazon said it’s creating <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-amazon-jobs/amazon-plans-to-add-10000-jobs-in-bellevue-washington-idUSKBN25V22X?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">10,000 more jobs</a> in Bellevue, WA, a city near its Seattle HQ. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>That’s in addition to the 25,000 it already planned to hire in Bellevue in February.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>That’s in addition to the 175,000 people it hired earlier in the pandemic as demand surged.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Unlike some other Big Tech companies, like Facebook and Twitter, Amazon thinks a <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/amazon-is-hiring-and-expanding-its-offices-inside-the-tech-giants-strategy-11597853961?mod=hp_lista_pos2&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">physical office</a> is the key to world domination, and it’s building massive developments in the Seattle area to accommodate future employees. That’s sure to face some pushback, though, since the company’s footprint has been blamed for exacerbating Seattle’s housing crisis. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line:</strong> Amazon will eventually have <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-09-04/amazon-to-have-as-many-workers-in-seattle-suburb-as-virginia-hq2?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">as many employees</a> in Bellevue as its “HQ2” in northern Virginia.</p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
INTERNATIONAL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/04/international-news-update?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
From the International News Desk
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<img alt="Lionel Messi celebrating for Barcelona " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMzM3L2xpb25lbF9tZXNzaV9jZWxlYnJhdGluZy5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>David Ramos/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Believe it or not, there is a world beyond the local Bertucci’s. Let’s get an update from our foreign correspondent, Carlisle Sanfrancisco. Carlisle?</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Spain: </strong>Looks like soccer wizard Lionel Messi will <a href="https://www.goal.com/en-us/news/messis-barcelona-heartbreak-revealed-from-his-sons-tears-to/1mpozogbymuza1fep1f6vv3oz2?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">remain with Barcelona</a> for one more year. Messi caused a minor earthquake after he made moves to leave the club this summer, but in the end, he wanted to avoid what would’ve been a bitter legal dispute over his contract. He still called the club’s management a “disaster.” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The Balkans: </strong>Kosovo and Serbia, two countries with a violent past, <a href="https://apnews.com/3b7aca39c6829655d43de30f68497ed1?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">normalized</a> economic relations in a White House ceremony. Israel also played a big role—it established diplomatic relations with Kosovo, and Serbia said it would move its embassy to Jerusalem.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Japan: </strong>A cargo ship <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/world/2020/sep/03/typhoon-maysak-ship-with-43-crew-and-nearly-6000-cattle-missing-off-japan?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sank</a> off the coast this week after running into Typhoon Maysak. It was carrying 43 crew members and nearly 6,000 cattle from New Zealand to China. Rescue operations are underway, but only a couple of survivors have been found. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Italy: </strong>The Venice Film Festival, the world’s oldest, is <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/09/04/movies/venice-film-festival-coronavirus.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">actually happening</a>. It started on Wednesday and runs through the 12th.</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We’ve spent our entire summer vacation attempting to make rainbow slime.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It is not going well, there’s slime everywhere, and it’s almost time to take yet another biology class from Dr. Von Borenstein. </p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Now we hate this slime even more! And Dr. Von Borenstein has already given us homework!</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://join.skillshare.com/mb-2020/?coupon=morningbrew21&utm_source=ExternalNewsletter&utm_medium=paid-morningbrew&utm_campaign=mktg-2020-9-5_morningbrew21" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Skillshare is an online learning community</a> with <strong style="color:#000">thousands of classes</strong> about things that you just won’t learn in a normal classroom. You can <strong style="color:#000">explore new things</strong>, <strong style="color:#000">further passions</strong> you already have, and simply <strong style="color:#000">get lost in creativity</strong>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So even if you’re headed back to the (virtual or IRL) classroom, why not also learn a more creative skill all from the comfort of your slime-free home with a <a href="https://join.skillshare.com/mb-2020/?coupon=morningbrew21&utm_source=ExternalNewsletter&utm_medium=paid-morningbrew&utm_campaign=mktg-2020-9-5_morningbrew21" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Skillshare subscription that's only $10 per month</a>?</p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPORTS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/09/04/derby-day?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
It's Derby Day
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Churchill Downs" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMzM2L2NodXJjaGlsbF9kb3ducy5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Jamie Squire/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And even if it is a few months late, it still means lots of betting.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">More than $165 million was wagered on last year’s Kentucky Derby, a record amount for the 146-year-old race and a <a href="https://www.ibtimes.com/kentucky-derby-2020-expected-set-betting-record-3040434?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">10% increase over 2018</a>. With horse racing viewership up 300% since the beginning of the year and no one allowed at the track due to the pandemic, odds are we’re in for another record day of gambling. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">One potential hiccup: </strong></span><span>Las Vegas sportsbooks have yet to agree to a deal with Churchill Downs, the racetrack that hosts the Derby, over the handling of </span><span><a href="https://www.espn.com/chalk/story/_/id/29801430/nevada-bookmakers-dispute-churchill-downs-kentucky-derby-pari-mutuel-wagering?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">pari-mutuel wagering</a></span><span>. That means payouts for bets involving multiple horses (like trifectas and superfectas) may be capped for Vegas bettors. That could greatly reduce betting activity if a last-gasp deal isn’t reached before the race.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Another, much smaller, hiccup:</strong></span><span> Maine barred anyone from </span><span><a href="https://wgme.com/sports/content/maine-only-state-banned-from-betting-on-kentucky-derby?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">betting on the Derby</a></span><span> this year, the only state to do so. Sorry Mainers.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Here is <a href="https://www.kentuckyderby.com/horses/leaderboard?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">this year’s field</a>.<strong style="color:#000"> </strong>The Brew Sports algorithm is all-in on a colt named Major Fed, but don’t get your hopes up—as a massive 50-1 underdog and contending with historically low interest rates, he probably won’t yield much.</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">52% of young adults in the U.S. lived with at least one of their parents in July, according to <a href="https://www.pewresearch.org/fact-tank/2020/09/04/a-majority-of-young-adults-in-the-u-s-live-with-their-parents-for-the-first-time-since-the-great-depression/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">new research</a> from Pew.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">

SATURDAY HEADLINES
</h3>
</td>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You know all about “Florida man” headlines, but sometimes “generic man” headlines are just as bizarre. Three of these stories describe a man doing something downright strange (but true), while one is totally made up. Can you spot the fake? </p>
<ol style="list-style-type: lower-alpha;">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>"Man aims to see </span><span><em>Tenet </em></span><span><a href="https://www.upi.com/Odd_News/2020/09/01/Man-aims-to-see-Tenet-120-times-for-Guinness-record/2401598983881/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">120 times</a></span><span> for Guinness record"</span>

in August and the unemployment rate fell to 8.4% from 10.2% in July. Employers are hiring back workers they recently let go at a steady clip, however many job losses are becoming permanent.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli href=\"https://www.npr.org/2020/09/04/909627932/feds-jerome-powell-jobless-rate-better-than-expected-recovery-to-take-a-long-tim?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWrapped up in Thursday’s fourth-largest daily point drop in Nasdaq history, and yesterday’s grim-but-not-as-grim second act, is a series of intriguing storylines.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eGreen traders get battle scars\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe rash of inexperienced individual investors getting involved in risky options trading has been a consistent theme during the market’s epic rally. And vets who preached caution are finally getting their “told you so” moment. With \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-09-03/day-trader-options-frenzy-turns-ugly-in-730-billion-nasdaq-rout?srnd=premium\u0026sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$730 billion worth of value\u003c/a\u003e erased from the Nasdaq on Thursday, lots of poorly timed options contracts were wiped out. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eInsiders have been selling\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eU.S. executives \u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/78ed6f29-a8ea-4c46-aba0-556eae378b79?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esold $6.7 billion\u003c/a\u003e worth of their own companies’ stock in August. If that sounds like a lot, it is.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eLast month’s garage sale was the largest monthly tally since November 2015, while the number of execs cashing out was the highest in two years, according to the FT.  \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSelling activity like this paints a less-than-optimistic picture for the future, but who can blame insiders for “harvesting a once-in-a-millennium bonanza,” macro strategist Vincent Deluard told the FT. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eSoftBank flies too close to the Son\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNever one to miss out on massive trades with extreme risk, the Japanese tech conglomerate led by Masayoshi Son has been revealed as the “\u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/75587aa6-1f1f-4e9d-b334-3ff866753fa2?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eNasdaq whale\u003c/a\u003e” that’s been snapping up an astonishing amount of options tied to Big Tech companies. In addition to buying nearly $4 billion worth of shares in the likes of Amazon, Apple, and Netflix, SoftBank reportedly spent another $4 billion purchasing \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/softbanks-bet-on-tech-giants-fueled-powerful-market-rally-11599232205?mod=breakingnews\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebullish call options\u003c/a\u003e that would pay off bigtime if those stocks hit a certain level in the future. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSome investors say SoftBank's activity may have been partly responsible for the recent surge in Big Tech stocks. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFlashback: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eNow might be a good time to remember Son \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/04/23/masayoshi-son-invested-in-bitcoin-and-reportedly-lost-130-million.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elost over $130 million\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e of his own money after getting into bitcoin around its peak in 2017. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eMost analysts say not to read too much into the recent sell-off, given the Fed's pledge to support markets with liquidity and the ongoing economic style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eAmazon\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBezos is out here memorizing Rachmaninoff's third while the rest of us are learning “Chopsticks.” The same day stocks continued their sell-off and the jobs report showed a labor market still in tatters...Amazon said it’s creating \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-amazon-jobs/amazon-plans-to-add-10000-jobs-in-bellevue-washington-idUSKBN25V22X?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e10,000 more jobs\u003c/a\u003e in Bellevue, WA, a city near its Seattle HQ. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThat’s in addition to the 25,000 it already planned to hire in Bellevue in February.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThat’s in addition to the 175,000 people it hired earlier in the pandemic as demand surged.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eUnlike some other Big Tech companies, like Facebook and Twitter, Amazon thinks a \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/amazon-is-hiring-and-expanding-its-offices-inside-the-tech-giants-strategy-11597853961?mod=hp_lista_pos2\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ephysical office\u003c/a\u003e is the key to world domination, and it’s building massive developments in the Seattle area to accommodate future employees. Let’s get an update from our foreign correspondent, Carlisle Sanfrancisco. Carlisle?\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSpain: \u003c/strong\u003eLooks like soccer wizard Lionel Messi will \u003ca href=\"https://www.goal.com/en-us/news/messis-barcelona-heartbreak-revealed-from-his-sons-tears-to/1mpozogbymuza1fep1f6vv3oz2?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eremain with Barcelona\u003c/a\u003e for one more year. Messi caused a minor earthquake after he made moves to leave the club this summer, but in the end, he wanted to avoid what would’ve been a bitter legal dispute over his contract. He still called the club’s management a “disaster.” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe Balkans: \u003c/strong\u003eKosovo and Serbia, two countries with a violent past, \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/3b7aca39c6829655d43de30f68497ed1?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enormalized\u003c/a\u003e economic relations in a White House ceremony. Israel also played a big role—it established diplomatic relations with Kosovo, and Serbia said it would move its embassy to Jerusalem.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eJapan: \u003c/strong\u003eA cargo ship \u003ca href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/world/2020/sep/03/typhoon-maysak-ship-with-43-crew-and-nearly-6000-cattle-missing-off-japan?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esank\u003c/a\u003e off the coast this week after running into Typhoon Maysak. It was carrying 43 crew members and nearly 6,000 cattle from New Zealand to China. Rescue operations are underway, but only a couple of survivors have been found. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eItaly: \u003c/strong\u003eThe Venice Film Festival, the world’s oldest, is \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/09/04/movies/venice-film-festival-coronavirus.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eactually happening\u003c/a\u003e. lots of betting.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMore than $165 million was wagered on last year’s Kentucky Derby, a record amount for the 146-year-old race and a \u003ca href=\"https://www.ibtimes.com/kentucky-derby-2020-expected-set-betting-record-3040434?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e10% increase over 2018\u003c/a\u003e. With horse racing viewership up 300% since the beginning of the year and no one allowed at the track due to the pandemic, odds are we’re in for another record day of gambling. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eOne potential hiccup: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eLas Vegas sportsbooks have yet to agree to a deal with Churchill Downs, the racetrack that hosts the Derby, over the handling of \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.espn.com/chalk/story/_/id/29801430/nevada-bookmakers-dispute-churchill-downs-kentucky-derby-pari-mutuel-wagering?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epari-mutuel wagering\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. That means payouts for bets involving multiple horses (like trifectas and superfectas) may be capped for Vegas bettors. That could greatly reduce betting activity if a last-gasp deal isn’t reached before the race.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAnother, much smaller, hiccup:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e Maine barred anyone from \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://wgme.com/sports/content/maine-only-state-banned-from-betting-on-kentucky-derby?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebetting on the Derby\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e this year, the only state to do so. Sorry Mainers.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eHere is \u003ca href=\"https://www.kentuckyderby.com/horses/leaderboard?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ethis year’s field\u003c/a\u003e.\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e \u003c/strong\u003eThe Brew Sports algorithm is all-in on a colt named Major Fed,
